title: LG’s wireless-ish OLED TVs start at $7,000
description: Wireless-ish—but TV and port box still need power cords.

title: Florida man gets unexplained leprosy case; doctors suspect local soil
description: Leprosy is not very contagious, and the CDC has not issued a travel advisory.

title: Author discovers AI-generated counterfeit books written in her name on Amazon
description: Amazon resisted a removal request, citing lack of "trademark registration numbers."

title: With new Game Controller app, Netflix games move from mobile to the TV
description: The streamer promises you'll be able to use it to play games on your TV soon.

title: Valve starts selling refurbished Steam Decks for up to $130 less than new models
description: Refurb units "meet or even exceed performance standards of new retail units."

title: Google, record labels working on deal covering musical “deepfakes”
description: Prepare for more cover songs like Johnny Cash singing Barbie Girl.

title: Banks fined $549M after senior execs found secretly texting on Signal, WhatsApp
description: Banks have been fined more than $2.5 billion for violating record-keeping laws.

title: Disney explores cutting costs through AI use
description: House of Mickey hopes AI will help control soaring TV and film production costs.

title: What does it take to get AI to work like a scientist?
description: Getting AI to find scientific laws sometimes works, but it's a long way from science.

title: Developer logs reveal more details about next-gen Apple M3 and M3 Max chips
description: Compared to M2 Max, M3 Max could come with four more high-performance cores.

title: Pope warns of AI risks so “violence and discrimination does not take root”
description: Papal communiqué warns of AI produced "at the expense of the most fragile and excluded."

title: Amazon gets “last rites” from FTC as antitrust complaint looks imminent
description: FTC's lawsuit is likely to be filed in federal court this month.

title: Here’s how ChargePoint plans to increase EV charger reliability
description: A new Network Operations Center is aimed to bring ChargePoint close to 100% uptime.

title: The helicopter on Mars just flew again after surviving an emergency landing
description: "The helicopter worked as planned and executed an immediate landing."

title: Rogue planets may be more numerous than stars in our galaxy
description: Planets cast loose from their exosolar system are remarkably common.

title: Rest in peace Bram Moolenaar, author of Vim and hero of many developers
description: The open source software legend left us on August 3 at age 62.

title: General Motors will add bidirectional charging to its Ultium-based EVs
description: The rollout starts with 2024 models, including the Silverado and Blazer EVs.

title: Crucial early-warning listserv for tracking disease outbreaks is in danger
description: ProMED, which broke news of COVID, SARS, and MERS, is short on cash and in turmoil.

title: Efficient motors and LFP batteries will power this new medium-duty truck
description: Motiv has been making electric powertrains for other chassis for 14 years now.
